ratings.comment: Not much was done in lecture, a lot of the grade is based on just completion of homework. There aren't any tests. She is a good and engaging lecturer who cares about the material. She brings in a guest lecturer each week and they were all decent. Overall a good experience.

Overall great professor emphasises learning skills that rarely are taught, such as, presenting information to lay audiences, condensing- and presenting information in a timely sensitive manner! 100% recommended

I loved class with Dr. Shields. She didn't try to make the class any harder than it needed to be, and also was very clear on what was expected of assignments with many reminders of when things were due. No quizzes or exams, which made the class very low-stress. Very accessible outside of class and really wants her students to do well!

This class was an intro class and Dr. Shields knew it. She knew students were time consumed with classes like calc, chem, and physics, so she kept it simple. Reading assignments were the majority of the work. Lectures were entertaining and guest speakers were frequent. Highly recommend.

Morgan was the nicest and most flexible professor I've ever had. During such an awful time of online classes, it can feel like professors will do anything to make your life more difficult. Morgan was always willing, without fail, to work with me and grant extensions during such a tumultuous time in my life. Class was easy.

Get ready to stretch your hands out before every class because professor shields talks faster than a lightning strike. She knows what she's talking about but makes it harder for students to take the time to grasp the subjects before she moves on to the next idea. If you don't do almost all the reading before class you'll be behind.
